Title: Don't have too ambitious of a plan
Description: It's natural to want to fit in as many attractions and activities as you can, but don't get caught up in your schedule and forget to enjoy your trip. Instead of planning out every minute of every day, only schedule the essential activities and let the rest of your journey be open to free exploration!

Title: Pack Smart
Description: You don't want to be bogged down by a heavy suitcase on your vacation, so pack light with plenty of layers for every occasion. Don't forget to pack adapters for your electronics and a compact toiletry bag. Keep in mind that rolling your clothes can sometimes save space compared to folding them, and can help with wrinkles.

Title: Learn Key Phrases
Description: While you don't necessarily need to be fluent in the language of your destination, knowing some key phrases like "Hello", "Thank you", and "Where is the bathroom?" can take you a long way while in a foreign country. Not only will these phrases allow you to easily navigate throughout your destination, but they will also help show the locals that you're willing to go above and beyond to fit in with their culture!

Title: Research Modes of Transportation
Description: Different countries and cities have various ways of getting around, and many major cities have plenty of public transportation to help you get where you need to be fast and cheap. Take some time to research before your vacation to discover the best way to get around, and look for any apps or websites used by locals to help you buy tickets.

Title: Try Local Food
Description: Don't be afraid to go out of your comfort zone and try something new. After all, that's what a vacation is all about! Talk to locals about traditional foods that are a must-have in the area, and make sure to try some to get the full vacation experience.

Title: Be Respectful of Local Customs
Description: Cultures vary widely throughout the world, so make sure you are aware of the practices locals follow in your vacation destination. Look out for dress codes and ways of showing respect, especially if visiting a religious area.

Title: Keep a Digital Copy of Your Passport
Description: While your physical passport is a must-have on your travels, a digital copy can help you in a situation where your passport gets misplaced or stolen. It's always good to have a backup.

Title: Budget More Than You Think You'll Need
Description: Vacationing can get costly fast, so it's good to have a little room in your budget for souvenirs, tips, and other expenses. You never know what will come up, and sometimes activities or food can be more expensive than you expect, so having a large budget will help prevent any surprises.

Title: Be Aware of Your Surroundings
Description: Pickpocketing is common in any place that sees a lot of tourists, so consider purchasing a money belt or crossbody bag to keep your valuables close to you. Never keep your smartphone in your back pocket, and always be vigilant in unfamiliar neighborhoods.

Title: Stay Hydrated and Healthy
Description: Keep a water bottle and some snacks on you throughout your day, especially if you're doing a lot of walking around. Try to eat regularly and bring sunscreen and a hat to protect from the sun.
